definition: in (some place)/to be in (adversity, a difficult situation, danger, turmoil etc)/to find oneself in/placed in/surrounded by
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
to put oneself in sb else's shoes
the way of one's conduct and interaction in society (idiom)

sentences.english: He was in a tiny capsule called Friendship 7.
sentences.chinese: 他身處一個叫做友誼7號的小型太空艙。

sentences.english: And we’re on the edge of a truly great breakthrough.
sentences.chinese: 我們現在正身處一個重大的突破的邊緣。

sentences.english: Tens of thousands were stranded in other areas, the national fire service said, according to Reuters.
sentences.chinese: 據路透社報道，國家消防局說，好幾萬人身處險境。

sentences.english: Your job is to look at the American economy and all the people in it.
sentences.chinese: 你的工作就是看着美國經濟總量和身處其中的人。

sentences.english: The company at the center of the storm is Synutra.
sentences.chinese: 身處事件風暴中心的公司是聖元國際集團。

sentences.english: You know, only if you were there did you realize that after the quake, there were follow-on quakes for days on end.
sentences.chinese: 只有身處日本，你才知道大地震後餘震持續了多少天。

sentences.english: You're on Yundang Hu, better known as Coffee Street.
sentences.chinese: 此時，你一定身處篔簹湖，有名的咖啡一條街。

sentences.english: Before the interview, put yourself in the interviewer's shoes to see things from their perspective。
sentences.chinese: 在面試前，設身處地的從面試官的角度去看問題。

sentences.english: And, because we live here, what relevance does it have for Asia?
sentences.chinese: 與我們身處的亞洲又有甚麼關係？

sentences.english: Eg: The police descended on their hide-out.
sentences.chinese: 警察突然襲擊了他們的藏身處。

sentences.english: Learn from them; live in their shoes; and befriend them.
sentences.chinese: 向他們學習，設身處地，待之如友。

sentences.english: This generation has already been beaten down and is hurting.
sentences.chinese: 這一代人已經被擊垮了，正身處痛苦之中。

sentences.english: MRS. ALLONBY. I should like to see Lord Illingworth in a happy English home.
sentences.chinese: 我很想見到伊爵士身處英格蘭的溫馨家庭。

sentences.english: Recovery of pure consciousness actually find themselves living in the Heian Kyoto.
sentences.chinese: 恢復意識的純發現自己竟身處平安時代的京都。

sentences.english: The Siqian dialect is not quite the same as the dialect spoken in Siyi area, Guangdong, where Siqian is located.
sentences.chinese: 司前話，與它身處的廣東四邑地區所說的話不太相同。

sentences.english: As the sun rose, a dew drop became aware of its surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 太陽昇起時，一顆露珠兒才知道了自己身處何處。

definition: immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
